official_title: Affiliated Assistant Professor, Faculty Fellow, NYU Shanghai; Postdoctoral Fellow, NYU
bio: Eric Goldwyn is a research scholar at NYU's Marron Institute of Urban Management and an Affiliated Assistant Professor, Faculty Fellow at NYU Shanghai. His research examines the impact of transportation technologies on human behavior and urban form. He is currently working on a large-scale project mapping unmapped transit networks across the globe. He received a BA in History from Bowdoin College, M.U.P from NYU, and Ph.D. from Columbia University.
